newsitem.title: UK: U.S., Europe truckers link to UK cargo data system.
newsitem.headline: U.S., Europe truckers link to UK cargo data system.

text.p: European trucking organisation Rutges and U.S.-owned ground handler Ogden Cargo have made the first international connections to the UK cargo community computer system CCS-UK, said the system's designer and manager, Syntegra.
Syntegra is British Telecommunications Plc's systems integrations business.

It said that Rutges, which specialises in trucking services for the airfreight industry, has connected its 'Starwheels' computer system in Rotterdam to CCS-UK to facilitate electronic communications with its airline and freight forwarding customers.

"We are developing electronic data interchange (EDI) as a means of communicating with our customers, which is very much in line with their own business objectives," said Rutges project manager Dick Foote.
He added that the connection provided operational benefits for Rutges' locations around Europe -- particularly in its "core" countries of the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France and the UK/Ireland.
Syntegra said Ogden Cargo had connected its ABS2000 ground handling system locations in Barcelona and Madrid to CCS-UK.
ABS2000 is now on-line to 65 transit sheds and other locations internationally and through CCS-UK to major international airlines, said Syntegra.
